thread.title: C-M’s Myers sets two school records in win over Iowa Valley
thread.title_full: C-M’s Myers sets two school records in win over Iowa Valley

title: C-M’s Myers sets two school records in win over Iowa Valley
text:
C-M’s Myers sets two school records in win over Iowa Valley Published: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 11:19 a.m. CDT • Updated: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 11:20 a.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
MARENGO — Scoring seven touchdowns in 18 first-half plays, the Colfax-Mingo football team cruised to its sixth straight win of the season Friday night. 
Jared Myers was 18-of-22 for 433 yards and seven touchdowns as the Tigerhawks led 46-8 at halftime before putting things on cruise control in a 58-32 victory over Iowa Valley in Class A District 7 play. 
The Tigerhawks are 6-1 on the year and 5-0 in district play. They’ll get a shot at the district title Friday when they host No. 2 BGM in Colfax. Kick off is at 7 p.m. 
Colfax-Mingo locked up no worse than a No. 2 seed out of District 7 with its win over Iowa Valley. 
Myers hooked up with Colin Lourens for three scores and Jacob Lietz for two touchdowns. Blake Summy and Gabe Simpson each hauled in one touchdown pass. Myers ran in a touchdown and Jacob Buehrer had a touchdown run. 
The Tigerhawks led 21-0 after one quarter. Myers began the scoring with a 72-yard touchdown strike to Summy, who finished with 101 yards on three catches. 
It was 14-0 following Myers’ 70-yard touchdown pass to Summy, who caught two passes for 81 yards. 
The lead grew to 21-0 when Myers found Lietz on a 25-yard touchdown pass play. Myers began the second half with an 11-yard touchdown run and then Myers answered Iowa Valley’s first score with back-to-back touchdown passes to Lourens for 36 and 20 yards, respectively. 
The Tigerhawks scored three touchdowns in the final 5:36 of the half. Lourens’ second touchdown catch came with 27 seconds left. 
On the final play of the first half, Myers hooked up with Lourens, who then pitched it to Lietz for an 88-yard touchdown play. 
The two second-half touchdowns were a 9-yard pass from Myers to Lourens in the third and a 1-yard run by Buehrer in the fourth. 
The seven touchdowns and 433 passing yards by Myers are both new single-game school records. He had 55 rushing yards on five carries. 
Lietz finished with five catches for a team-high 132 yards and two scores. He led the defense with 11 tackles. 
Lourens finished with 103 yards and three touchdowns on six catches, while Buehrer finished with 39 rushing yards and 7.5 tackles. Alan Wheeler also had 7.5 tackles and Jimmy Camp had an interception. 
Bennett Goettsch rushed for 198 yards and two scores to lead Iowa Valley, while Hudephol Brayden added 98 rushing yards and two touchdowns. 
Colfax-Mingo 21-25-6-6—58 
C-M — Summy 72-yd pass from Myers (missed kick) 
C-M — Simpson 70-yd pass from Myers (Summy run) 
C-M — Lietz 25-yd pass from Myers (Buehrer kick) 
C-M — Myers 11-yd run (missed kick) 
IAV — Goettsch 1-yard run (Goettsch run) 
C-M — Lourens 36-yd pass from Myers (pass failed) 
C-M — Lourens 20-yd pass from Myers (pass failed) 
C-M — Lietz 88-yd pass from Myers (Buehrer kick) 
C-M — Lourens 9-yd pass from Myers (missed kick) 
IAV — Brayden 24-yd run (Goettsch run) 
IAV — Goettsch 65-yd run (Brayden run) 
C-M — Buehrer 1-yard run (missed kick) 
IAV — Brayden 8-yd run (Megchelen run)
